weather.precipitation: Fall in Salzburg is characterized by moderate rainfall, with occasional drizzles and mist.
weather.what_to_pack: Pack layers for varying temperatures, waterproof clothing, and sturdy walking shoes.

tourism.crowds: Fall sees fewer tourists compared to the peak summer season, making it a more peaceful time to visit.
tourism.costs: Accommodation and attraction prices are generally lower than in the summer.
tourism.booking_advice: Book accommodations and tours in advance for popular attractions like Hohensalzburg Fortress.

highlights.name: Salzburg Festival
highlights.description: Celebration of classical music and drama in various venues across the city.
highlights.tips: Purchase tickets early for popular performances.

highlights.name: Autumn Colors in Mirabell Gardens
highlights.description: Stunning display of fall foliage in the well-manicured gardens.
highlights.tips: Visit in the morning for the best light and fewer crowds.

highlights.name: Almabtrieb
highlights.description: Traditional festival celebrating the return of cattle from alpine pastures.
highlights.tips: Experience the festive atmosphere in nearby villages like St. Gilgen.

highlights.name: Salzburg Marathon
highlights.description: Scenic marathon race through the historic city and surrounding countryside.
highlights.tips: Plan travel around road closures during the event.

highlights.name: Mozart Week
highlights.description: Commemoration of Mozart's music with concerts and events at various venues.
highlights.tips: Check the program in advance and book tickets for desired performances.

highlights.name: Hiking in the Tennengebirge Mountains
highlights.description: Enjoy the vibrant fall colors and crisp mountain air on hiking trails.
highlights.tips: Check trail conditions and weather forecasts before setting out.

recommended_activities.practical_tips: Join a guided tour to enjoy the region's best wines.
